definition: good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: I hope it stays nice for the whole month.
sentences.chinese: 我希望整個月天氣都這樣晴好。

sentences.english: The fine weather allures the children into the park.
sentences.chinese: 晴好的天氣，把孩子們都吸引到了公園裏。

sentences.english: The weather held up and the game was played.
sentences.chinese: 天氣持續晴好，比賽得以進行。

sentences.english: It's sunny today,and you'd better remain out for an hour.
sentences.chinese: 今天天氣晴好，你最好在戶外呆一小時。

sentences.english: One fine morning, he set out from his home with the intention of hunting a deer in the nearby forest.
sentences.chinese: 一天上午，天氣晴好，他打算到附近的林中打鹿。

sentences.english: There is no doubt that there will be a long spell of fine weather in this region.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，本地區晴好的天氣將持續很長一段時間。

sentences.english: We hope the weather will hold up.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望天氣繼續晴好。

sentences.english: Luckily, it is a nice day for walking in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 那是一個晴好的天氣，很多人都到公園裏來了。

definition: Heaven is cooperating (idiom)/the weather is favorable for the planned activity (a variation of 天公不作美|天公不作美[tian1 gong1 bu4 zuo4 mei3])
moderate wind, beautiful sun (idiom); fine sunny weather, esp. in springtime
(idiom) sunlight shines over all things/drenched in sunlight
